reasoning_log: The matching process prioritized unique room types (Kitchen, Parking, Bathrooms) first, followed by distinguishing features within similar room categories (Living Rooms, Bedrooms). Desc_3 (Kitchen) and Desc_10 (Parking) were immediate, high-confidence matches (Image_3, Image_10). Bathrooms (Desc_5, Desc_8) were differentiated by floor color/texture (Image_5) versus the presence of a decorative border tile (Image_8). The four Living Room descriptions (Desc_1, 2, 11, 12) were matched based on furniture complexity and built-in features: Image_2 showed the simplest setup with a potential shoe area (Desc_2). Images 1, 11, and 12 all feature built-in TV walls. Image_11 and Image_12 are very similar, but both show the long, modern TV wall and entrance door, fitting Desc_11 and Desc_12 (spacious/ample storage). Image_1 was assigned to Desc_1 (standard built-in cabinet). The two furnished bedrooms (Desc_4, Desc_6) and two empty bedrooms (Desc_7, Desc_9) were assigned arbitrarily to the visually identical pairs (4/6 and 7/9) as the descriptions were too generic to distinguish between the specific images within those pairs, relying only on the room type match.

matching_result_list.evidence: Living room with built-in TV cabinet/storage (內建電視櫃收納) and standard, regular layout (規則格局).
